content.raw: Is there anything that I need to update? or does this pull request ready to be merged?
content.html: Is there anything that I need to update? or does this pull request ready to be merged?

content.raw:
I think a default value of 1 is probably good. We should have a major release since it will change results.

This explanation should be in `Model generation` in the docs, nearer to the other `--prior-strength` option. Make a new subsection right before `Task selection`.

We should also change the name of `--prior-strength` since there are multiple priors, but keep `--prior-strength` as a deprecated synonym.
content.html:
I think a default value of 1 is probably good. We should have a major release since it will change results.

This explanation should be in Model generation in the docs, nearer to the other --prior-strength option. Make a new subsection right before Task selection.

We should also change the name of --prior-strength since there are multiple priors, but keep --prior-strength as a deprecated synonym.

content.raw: @hoffman what do you think of the description and the new default value? I don't fully understand the description and the need for a default pseudocount vs. running a more than 1 instance for avoid local optima.
content.html: @hoffman what do you think of the description and the new default value? I don't fully understand the description and the need for a default pseudocount vs. running a more than 1 instance for avoid local optima.

content.raw: Yes. Yes. I think the scale of the number is the integer. The default is 1 since 1 is the smallest number to consider.
content.html: Yes. Yes. I think the scale of the number is the integer. The default is 1 since 1 is the smallest number to consider.

content.raw: Yes, that's true
content.html: Yes, that's true

content.raw: The local test (simpleseg) would fail because there are "3 differences for ../simpleseg/touchstone/identifydir/log/details.sh" when I run the test.
content.html: The local test (simpleseg) would fail because there are "3 differences for ../simpleseg/touchstone/identifydir/log/details.sh" when I run the test.

content.raw: @Shiqi_Zou code looks great. Documentation is still a little unclear. Do the local tests (like simpleseg) pass?
content.html: @Shiqi_Zou code looks great. Documentation is still a little unclear. Do the local tests (like simpleseg) pass?

content.raw:
EM will, in general, find local optimums. Psuedocounts don't remove this altogether correct? This is only for the cases where there's a 0 probability between a label transition?

Why is the default 1? What is the kind of scale that should be used for setting these numbers? More clarification about this feature would be great.
content.html:
EM will, in general, find local optimums. Psuedocounts don't remove this altogether correct? This is only for the cases where there's a 0 probability between a label transition?

Why is the default 1? What is the kind of scale that should be used for setting these numbers? More clarification about this feature would be great.

content.raw: Why is say in brackets here? Probably better to lead with "For example," instead of "In general"
content.html: Why is say in brackets here? Probably better to lead with "For example," instead of "In general"
